Description: Shoulder sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater with fillet at junction with neck; interior: glazed (vari-fired and worn) with added red band at junction; exterior: black band at junction of fillet and shoulder; below, alternating red and black tongues with reserved outline and narrow reserved band; on body, trace of undetermined, but seemingly unusual motif; inscription on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p.119, no. A205)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.036) (Phase 1)
